result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Edward Lewis

defendant.name: Lewis, Gerald Edward
defendant.address: 3217 West Wells Street, Room 7, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt:
All previous conditions of bail remain the same.
-Court ordered no contact with DLH, TTM, or JFG.
-No Contact/No Weapons.

Defendant Gerald Edward Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Gerald Edward Lewis.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court sets bail to $200.00; all previous conditions of bail remain the same. Defense received discovery and offer and requested status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36. Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant date scheduled for 10/27/22 at 8:30a.m. Parties notified.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
signed and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

Defendant Gerald Edward Lewis not in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Gerald Edward Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a scheduling conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 09-06-2022.

Defendant Gerald Edward Lewis in court in person.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court in person for Gerald Edward Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Received and Filed: Attorney Matthew Lamke
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 08-25-22
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Court ordered no contact with DLH, TTM, or JFG.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gerald Edward Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Gerald Edward Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Gerald Edward Lewis not in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/16/22 @ 1p
